column4: what is the syntax for removing (purging or removing) a package?
sudo apt-get --purge remove <package name>
whats the package name?
It was called jokosher.
cool
you can remove orphaned packages wth sudo apt-get autoremove

look at what its going to remove before continuing

not every system needs it so its optional
it will be on the cd if you enable your cd as a repo

then inset the cd you installed with and it will be installed from that'
I installed it with a live usb; How does that work?
you'll have to mount the usb to where the cd usually mounts, or edit the sources.list file so that it points where the usb mounts
sudo mount /media/disk /media/cdrom tells me that /media/disk is not a block device.....
/media/cdrom is already an folder so a symlink won't work. If you run: sudo umount /media/disk then mount the usb to /media/cdrom
